article.title: A Simple Generalised Plancherel Formula for Compactly Induced Characters

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this formula define?\n**(g *<sub>U</sub> f)(x) = ∫<sub>U</sub> g(u)f(u<sup>-1</sup>x)du**
choices: The convolution of two functions on the group G.
The inner product of two functions on the group G.
The action of the group U on a function on the group G.
The convolution of a function on U with a function on G.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is this formula called?\n**h(1) = ∫<sub>Ĝ</sub> Θ<sub>π</sub>(h)dμ<sub>π</sub>,  ∀h ∈ C<sub>c</sub>(G)**
What does θ<sub>π</sub>(g) represent in this formula?\n**Θ<sub>π</sub>(f) = ∫<sub>G</sub> f(g)θ<sub>π</sub>(g)dg,  (f ∈ C<sub>c</sub>(G))**
choices: The character of the representation π.
The kernel of the distribution character Θ<sub>π</sub>.
The matrix coefficient of the representation π.
The Plancherel measure associated with the representation π.
The Fourier transform of the function W<sub>ψ</sub>f.
The Plancherel Formula for the group G.
A generalised Plancherel formula for the function W<sub>ψ</sub>f.
The inverse Fourier transform of the distribution Φ<sub>π</sub><sup>ψ</sup>.
